ingredients.prep_note: drippings plus broth to make 1 1/2 cups

Put on rack in a baking pan and add grapefruit juice and water.

recipes.title: Turkey Cheddar Casserole

instructions.text: Cook noodles according to package directions; drain well and set aside.
Cook broccoli spears according to package directions; drain well. Cut broccoli into flowerets and coarsely chop stalks (keep separate); set aside.
Melt butter in a heavy saucepan over low heat. Add flour, stirring until smooth; cook 1 minute, stirring constantly.
Gradually add milk; cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until mixture is thickened and bubbly.
Add salt, pepper, and mustard; stir well. Remove from heat and add cheese, stirring until cheese melts.
Place half of reserved noodles in a greased 11 x 7 x 1 1/2 inch baking dish. Top with reserved broccoli stalks and turkey.

Sprinkle with almonds. Cover and bake at 350°F (175°C) for 30 minutes, or until hot and bubbly. Serves 6.

recipes.title: Stuffed Fish Rolls with Spinach (Microwave)
recipes.description: Light fish rolls stuffed with breadcrumb mixture, served on spinach.

ingredients.item: tartar sauce or Miracle Whip and pickle relish

instructions.text: In 1 quart microwaveable casserole. Combine spinach and 1/2 onion and pepper; drizzle 1 tablespoon water over vegetables. Cover and microwave on HIGH (100%) for 4 minutes, stirring once and rotating 1/2 turn halfway through cooking. Into 2 individual microwaveable casseroles, spoon 1/2 of the spinach mixture; set aside.
In same 1 quart casserole, combine the remaining onion, pepper, and garlic. Microwave on HIGH 1 minute, until onion is softened. Add bread crumbs, tartar sauce, and lemon juice and stir to combine.

Onto center of each fillet, spoon 1/2 of the bread crumb mixture. Roll each fillet jelly roll fashion; secure with toothpick. Set fillets in same 1 quart casserole; cover and microwave on HIGH for 4 minutes, rotating casserole 1/2 turn halfway through cooking.

Set each fillet over spinach mixture in each individual casserole; sprinkle each with 1/2 of the Parmesan cheese and paprika. Cover and microwave on HIGH for 30 seconds, until spinach is heated through.

notes: Only 207 calories per serving

recipes.title: Tortilla Casserole with Chicken and Black Beans
recipes.description: Layered tortilla casserole with chicken, black beans, enchilada sauce, and cheese.

ingredients.prep_note: or substitute cheddar or jack cheese

instructions.text: Spray a 9- by 13-inch baking dish with cooking spray and set aside. Heat oven to 350°F (175°C).
Remove skin from chicken. Cut the meat from the bones and dice. (You should have 1 1/2 - 2 cups.)
Combine the tomatoes and enchilada sauce. Drain the black beans, rinse and drain again. Combine with the chilies and green onions.

Spread a thin layer of the tomato sauce in the bottom of the prepared dish. Tear two of the tortillas in ragged pieces and spread in the pan. Top with the bean mixture. Drizzle with about 1/4 cup tomato sauce.
Tear another two tortillas and place on top of the beans. Spread chicken on top and sprinkle with 1/2 cup cheese. Drizzle with 1/4 cup sauce.
Tear the remaining 2 tortillas and place on top. Sprinkle with the olives. Pour remaining sauce over the casserole and sprinkle with remaining cheese.
Bake on center oven rack 35 minutes. Set aside 5 minutes before serving.

recipes.title: Kent's Basic Pasta (Bread Machine Dough)
recipes.description: Homemade pasta using bread machine for mixing - simple semolina and flour dough.

instructions.text: Measure all ingredients into bread pan.
Select Dough setting. Press "Start/Stop", and allow to mix 8 to 10 minutes.
Press "Start/Stop" to cancel. Remove dough.
Roll out on lightly floured surface to 1/8-inch thickness.
Dust with flour if dough is sticky.
Cut into 1/8-inch strips for narrow noodles or 1/4-inch for medium noodles.
Cook noodles in a large pot of boiling salted water for 10 to 15 minutes.
Drain in colander.

notes: Dough Setting – Not for Timer
Only use machine for mixing (8-10 minutes), not full dough cycle

assumptions: Estimated 6 servings based on total calories
Based on 5/5 ingredients (100% coverage)

recipes.title: Eric's Egg Pasta (Bread Machine Dough)
recipes.description: Rich egg pasta using bread machine for mixing - traditional semolina and egg dough.

instructions.text: Measure all ingredients into bread pan.
Select Dough setting. Press "Start/Stop", and allow to mix 8 to 10 minutes.
Press "Start/Stop" to cancel. Remove dough.
Roll out on lightly floured surface to 1/8-inch thickness.
Dust with flour if dough is sticky.
Cut into 1/8-inch strips for narrow noodles or 1/4-inch for medium noodles.
Cook noodles in a large pot of boiling salted water for 10 to 15 minutes.
Drain in colander.

notes: Dough Setting – Not for Timer
Only use machine for mixing (8-10 minutes), not full dough cycle

assumptions: Estimated 6 servings based on total calories
Based on 6/6 ingredients (100% coverage)

recipes.title: Seasoned Corn Meal Coating
recipes.source_note: Aunt Jemima corn meal mix package
recipes.description: Crispy seasoned coating for pan fried fish or oven fried chicken.

ingredients.item: AUNT JEMIMA Self-Rising Buttermilk Corn Meal Mix

instructions.text: FOR PAN FRIED FISH: Combine dry ingredients in mixing bowl. Coat 1-pound fish filets in dry ingredients. Dip in milk; coat again in dry ingredients. Heat 2-3 tbsp vegetable oil in large skillet over medium heat. Fry 2-3 minutes per side or until fish flakes easily with fork. (4 servings)

FOR OVEN FRIED CHICKEN: Preheat oven to 375°F. Combine dry ingredients in mixing bowl. Dip 2-1/2 pound cut-up broiler/fryer chicken in milk, then into dry ingredients. Place chicken skin side up on 15x10-inch jelly roll pan; lightly brush with 3 tbsp melted margarine or butter. Bake 50-55 minutes or until juices run clear when chicken is pierced with fork. (6 servings)

notes: Can be used for fish or chicken

assumptions: Based on 6/6 ingredients (100% coverage)

recipes.title: Slow Cooker Sausage Breakfast Casserole
recipes.description: Easy overnight breakfast casserole with hash browns, sausage, eggs, and cheese made in the slow cooker.

instructions.text: Spray a 6-quart slow cooker with cooking spray.
Layer half of the potatoes on the bottom of slow cooker.
Top with half of the sausage, mozzarella and Parmesan cheese, sun-dried tomatoes and green onion.
Repeat layering.
Beat eggs, milk, salt, and pepper in large bowl with a whisk until well blended.
Pour evenly over potato-sausage mixture.
Cook on low setting for 8 hours, or on high setting for 4 hours, or until eggs are set.

assumptions: Based on 10/10 ingredients (100% coverage)

recipes.title: Italian Meatball Sliders
recipes.description: Quick and easy meatball sliders with marinara and melted cheese.

ingredients.item: ciabatta, whole wheat, or sour dough buns, or dinner rolls

instructions.text: Combine meatballs and marinara sauce in a microwave safe bowl.
Microwave 1 minute or until warmed; toss to coat meatballs evenly with sauce.
Spoon meatballs over bottom of rolls; top with cheese and close sliders.

missing_inputs: Not in database: Farm Rich Original Meatballs
assumptions: Based on 2/4 ingredients (50% coverage)

recipes.title: Mustard-Glazed Ribs
recipes.description: For easier eating, ask your butcher to saw the ribs in half across the bones.

ingredients.item: meaty pork loin back ribs or spareribs

instructions.text: Cut ribs into single-rib portions. In a bowl combine 2 tablespoons brown sugar, paprika, turmeric, and 1/2 teaspoon salt. Rub mixture over ribs.
Roast ribs, meaty side up, in a shallow roasting pan in a 350° oven for 1 hour.
For sauce, in a saucepan combine the remaining brown sugar, onion, vinegar, mustard, celery seed, and garlic powder. Bring to boiling, stirring till sugar dissolves.
Drain fat from pan. Brush ribs with sauce. Roast 30 to 45 minutes more or till done, brushing frequently with sauce.

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 16)

recipes.title: Creamy Poached Eggs
recipes.description: Eggs poached in a creamy cheese sauce, served over toasted English muffins.

instructions.text: Toast muffins or bagels. In a medium skillet combine cheeses, milk, and 1/8 teaspoon pepper. Cook and stir over medium heat till cheeses melt.
Break 1 egg into a cup. Carefully slide egg into cheese mixture. Repeat with remaining eggs.
Cover; cook over medium-low heat for 3 to 5 minutes or to desired doneness.
Top each muffin or bagel half with an egg. Stir cheese mixture with a wire whisk. Spoon over eggs.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Poached Eggs
recipes.description: Perfect poached eggs, with variations including classic Eggs Benedict.

instructions.text: Lightly grease a saucepan, if desired, using a 2-quart pan for 3 or 4 eggs or a 1-quart pan for 1 or 2 eggs. Add water to half-fill the pan; stir in bouillon granules, if desired. Bring water to boiling. Reduce heat to simmering (bubbles should begin to break the surface of the water).

Break 1 egg into a measuring cup. Carefully slide egg into simmering water, holding the lip of the cup as close to the water as possible. Repeat with remaining eggs, allowing each egg an equal amount of space.
Simmer eggs, uncovered, for 3 to 5 minutes or to desired doneness. Remove with a slotted spoon. Season to taste with salt and pepper.

notes: Poacher-cup directions: Grease each cup of an egg-poaching pan. Place poacher cups over the pan of boiling water (water should not touch bottoms of cups). Reduce heat to simmering. Break 1 egg into a measuring cup. Carefully slide egg into a poacher cup. Repeat with remaining eggs. Cover and cook for 4 to 6 minutes or to desired doneness. Run a knife around edges to loosen eggs. Invert poacher cups to remove eggs.

Eggs Benedict: Before poaching eggs, split 2 English muffins. Place muffin halves and 8 slices Canadian-style bacon on a baking sheet. Bake in a 350° oven for 10 to 15 minutes or till muffins are toasted and bacon is hot. Keep warm. Place 4 poached eggs in a large pan of warm water to keep warm while preparing half a recipe of Hollandaise Sauce. To serve, top each muffin half with 2 slices of bacon and an egg; spoon sauce over eggs. Sprinkle with paprika and garnish with orange slices and parsley, if desired. Serves 4.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Huevos Rancheros
recipes.description: Featuring poached eggs and tortillas topped with a chili-pepper-spiked sauce. Huevos Rancheros is one hot dish.

ingredients.item: shredded Monterey Jack or American cheese

instructions.text: In a large skillet cook chopped onion in the 1 tablespoon oil till tender. Stir in undrained tomatoes, chili peppers, chili powder, and garlic powder. Simmer, uncovered, for 5 to 10 minutes or till slightly thickened.
Meanwhile, place tortillas on a baking sheet; brush lightly with the 1 teaspoon oil. Bake in a 350° oven about 10 minutes or till crisp.
Break 1 egg into a measuring cup. Carefully slide egg into simmering tomato mixture. Repeat with remaining eggs. Simmer gently, covered, for 3 to 5 minutes or to desired doneness.
To serve, place tortillas on 3 plates. Top each tortilla with 2 eggs; spoon tomato mixture over eggs. Sprinkle with cheese. Pass hot pepper sauce.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Soft-Cooked Eggs and Hard-Cooked Eggs
recipes.description: Perfect technique for soft-cooked and hard-cooked eggs.

instructions.text: Place 6 eggs in saucepan. Add enough cold water to cover eggs. Bring to boiling over high heat. Reduce heat so water is just below simmering; cover.
For soft-cooked eggs, cook 4 to 6 minutes. For hard-cooked eggs, cook 15 minutes. Drain.
For soft-cooked eggs, add cold water to the pan just till eggs are cool enough to handle. Cut off tops and serve in egg cups. Or, cut eggs in half and use a spoon to scoop the eggs into dishes.

For hard-cooked eggs, fill the saucepan with cold water and let stand 2 minutes. To quickly cool, add a few ice cubes. Drain. Gently tap each egg on the countertop. Roll egg between palms of hands. Peel off eggshell, starting at the large end.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Fried Eggs
recipes.description: No need to turn the eggs with this simple method.

ingredients.item: margarine or butter, or nonstick spray coating

instructions.text: In a large skillet melt margarine or butter over medium heat. (Or, spray a cold skillet with nonstick coating, then heat.) Add eggs.
When whites are set, add 1 teaspoon water. Cover skillet; cook eggs to desired doneness (about 2 minutes for soft or 4 minutes for firm).

notes: For 1 or 2 eggs, use a small skillet and 1 teaspoon margarine or butter.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Baked Eggs
recipes.description: Same great poached-egg taste, but less work.

ingredients.item: shredded cheddar, Swiss, or Monterey Jack cheese

instructions.text: Generously grease three 10-ounce casseroles with margarine.
Carefully break 2 eggs into each casserole; sprinkle with salt, pepper, and chives or herb.
Set casseroles into a 13x9x2-inch baking pan; place on an oven rack. Pour hot water around casseroles in pan to a depth of 1 inch.
Bake in a 325° oven about 25 minutes or till eggs are firm and whites are opaque.
If desired, after 20 minutes of cooking, sprinkle cheese atop eggs. Cook for 5 to 10 minutes more or till eggs are cooked and cheese melts.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Egg-Salad Sandwiches

ingredients.item: bread, or 2 small pita bread rounds or 2 bagels

instructions.text: In a bowl combine chopped eggs, green onion, and pimiento; stir in mayonnaise and mustard. Add salt and pepper to taste.
Spread egg mixture on 2 slices of bread, in pita rounds, or on bagel bottoms.
Top with lettuce and, if not using pitas, remaining bread slices or bagel tops.

notes: Greek-Style Egg-Salad Sandwiches: Prepare as above, except omit the pimiento and mustard. Stir 1/4 cup crumbled feta cheese, 1/4 cup finely chopped tomato, and 2 tablespoons chopped pitted ripe olives into egg mixture.

California-Style Egg-Salad Sandwiches: Prepare as above, except omit pimiento. Stir 1/4 cup chopped avocado and 1/4 cup shredded Monterey Jack cheese into egg mixture. Substitute alfalfa sprouts for lettuce.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Asparagus-Egg Casserole
recipes.description: Next time, try frozen chopped broccoli in place of the asparagus.

ingredients.item: crushed rich round or whole wheat crackers

instructions.text: Cook asparagus according to package directions; drain.

For sauce, in a medium saucepan cook onion and green pepper in the 2 tablespoons margarine till tender. Stir in flour, dry mustard, salt, and pepper. Add milk. Cook and stir till thickened and bubbly. Add cheese; stir till melted.
Reserve 1/4 cup asparagus. Stir remaining asparagus and chopped eggs into sauce. Pour into a 1-quart casserole.
Bake, covered, in a 375° oven for 10 minutes. Arrange reserved asparagus on top.
Combine crushed crackers with the melted margarine. Sprinkle atop casserole.
Bake, uncovered, for 10 minutes more.

notes: Microwave directions: Cook asparagus according to package microwave directions; drain. For sauce, in a 2-cup measure combine onion, green pepper, and the 2 tablespoons margarine. Micro-cook, uncovered, on 100% power (high) for 1-1/2 to 2-1/2 minutes or till tender. Stir in flour, dry mustard, salt, and pepper. Add milk. Stir to combine. Cook, uncovered, on high for 2 to 3 minutes or till thickened and bubbly, stirring every minute. Stir in cheese till melted. Reserve 1/4 cup asparagus. In a 1-quart casserole combine remaining asparagus and chopped eggs. Stir in sauce. Cook, covered, on high for 1 to 2 minutes or till heated through. Top with reserved asparagus. Combine crushed crackers with the melted margarine. Sprinkle cracker mixture atop casserole. Cook, uncovered, on high for 30 seconds more.

assumptions: Based on 13/13 ingredients (100% coverage)

recipes.title: Scrambled Eggs

instructions.text: In a bowl beat together eggs, milk or light cream, 1/4 teaspoon salt, and dash pepper.
In a large skillet melt margarine over medium heat; pour in egg mixture.
Cook, without stirring, till mixture begins to set on the bottom and around edge.
Using a large spoon or spatula, lift and fold partially cooked eggs so uncooked portion flows underneath.
Continue cooking over medium heat for 2 to 3 minutes or till eggs are cooked throughout but are still glossy and moist. Remove from the heat immediately.

notes: Microwave directions: In a 1-1/2-quart casserole micro-cook margarine on 100% power (high) for 35 to 40 seconds or till melted. Beat together eggs, milk, 1/4 teaspoon salt, and dash pepper. Pour into casserole with margarine. Cook, uncovered, on high for 4 to 5 minutes or till eggs are almost set, pushing cooked portions to the center after 1-1/2 minutes, then every 30 seconds. Let stand about 1 minute or till set.
Herbed Scrambled Eggs: Prepare as above, except add 1 tablespoon snipped parsley and 1/8 teaspoon dried thyme, crushed, to the beaten egg mixture.
Cream-Cheese Scrambled Eggs: Prepare as above, except add one 3-ounce package cream cheese with chives, cut into small cubes, to the beaten egg mixture.

Cheese-Onion Scrambled Eggs: Prepare as above, except cook 1 green onion, sliced, in margarine 30 seconds. Then add egg mixture. Add 1/2 cup shredded American cheese after eggs begin to set. Do not use microwave directions.

Mushroom Scrambled Eggs: Prepare as above, except increase margarine to 2 tablespoons. Cook 1/2 cup sliced fresh mushrooms and 1 tablespoon chopped onion in margarine. Add 1 tablespoon snipped parsley, 1/2 teaspoon dry mustard, and 1/4 teaspoon Worcestershire sauce to beaten egg mixture. Do not use the microwave directions.

Denver Scrambled Eggs: Prepare as above, except omit salt and increase margarine to 2 tablespoons. In the skillet cook 1/3 cup diced fully cooked ham; 1/4 cup chopped onion; one 2-ounce can mushroom stems and pieces, drained; and 2 tablespoons finely chopped green pepper in margarine. Then add egg mixture. Do not use the microwave directions.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Farmer's Breakfast
recipes.description: For a quicker breakfast, substitute frozen hash brown potatoes for the fresh potatoes.

instructions.text: In a large nonstick or well-seasoned skillet cook potatoes and onion in margarine over medium heat for 8 to 10 minutes or till tender; stir often.
Beat together eggs, milk, and 1/4 teaspoon pepper; stir in ham. Pour over potato mixture.
Cook, without stirring, till mixture begins to set on the bottom and around edge.
Using a large spoon, lift and fold partially cooked egg mixture so uncooked portion flows underneath.
Continue cooking about 4 minutes or till eggs are cooked throughout but still glossy and moist.

notes: Microwave directions: In a 1-1/2-quart casserole micro-cook onion and 2 tablespoons margarine or butter, uncovered, on 100% power (high) for 1 minute, stirring once. Add potatoes. Cook, covered, on high for 4 to 6 minutes or till potatoes are tender, stirring once. Beat together eggs, milk, and 1/4 teaspoon pepper; stir in ham. Pour over potato mixture. Cook on high for 4 to 5 minutes or till eggs are almost set, pushing cooked portions to center after 1-1/2 minutes, then every 30 seconds. Let stand about 1 minute or till eggs are set.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Scrambled-Egg Casserole
recipes.description: Use the make-ahead directions when you know your morning is going to be busy.

ingredients.item: chopped green pepper or sliced green onion
shredded American or process Swiss cheese
plain or seasoned fine dry bread crumbs

instructions.text: In a large skillet cook green pepper or onion in 1 tablespoon of the margarine till tender. Add eggs; cook over medium heat without stirring till mixture begins to set on bottom and around edge. Lift and fold partially cooked eggs so uncooked portion flows underneath. Continue cooking till just set. Transfer to a 1-quart casserole.

In a small saucepan melt 1 tablespoon of the margarine. Stir in flour and 1/8 teaspoon pepper. Add milk all at once. Cook and stir till thickened and bubbly. Stir in cheese till melted. Stir in pimiento. Fold cheese mixture into cooked eggs.
Melt remaining margarine; toss with crumbs. Sprinkle over egg mixture.
Bake in a 350° oven for 15 to 20 minutes or till hot.

notes: To make ahead: Prepare as above, except do not bake. Cover and refrigerate casserole for 3 to 24 hours. Bake, covered, 25 minutes. Uncover; bake 10 to 15 minutes more or till hot.

Microwave directions: In a 1-quart casserole micro-cook green pepper or onion and 1 tablespoon margarine, covered, on 100% power (high) for 1-1/2 to 2-1/2 minutes or till tender. Add beaten eggs. Cook on high for 2-1/2 to 3-1/2 minutes or till just set, pushing cooked portions to the center after 1-1/2 minutes, then every 30 seconds. In a 2-cup measure cook 1 tablespoon margarine on high for 35 to 40 seconds or till melted. Stir in flour and 1/8 teaspoon pepper. Add 1/2 cup milk. Stir to combine. Cook on high for 2 to 4 minutes or till thickened and bubbly, stirring every minute till mixture begins to thicken, then every 30 seconds. Add cheese; stir till melted. Stir in pimiento. Fold cheese mixture into cooked eggs. Cook remaining margarine on high for 35 to 40 seconds or till melted; toss with crumbs. Sprinkle over egg mixture. Cook on high for 2 to 3 minutes or till heated through.

assumptions: Based on 8/8 ingredients (100% coverage)

recipes.title: Eggs in a Puff
recipes.description: Cheesy eggs served in a cream puff shell.

ingredients.item: chopped green or sweet red pepper

instructions.text: For cream-puff shell, combine the 1/2 cup margarine and 1 cup water. Bring to boiling. Add flour and 1/4 teaspoon salt all at once, stirring vigorously. Cook and stir till mixture forms a ball that doesn't separate. Remove from heat. Cool 5 minutes.
Add 4 eggs, one at a time, beating with a wooden spoon after each addition till smooth. Spread over bottom and up the sides of a greased 9-inch pie plate.
Bake in a 400° oven for 25 to 30 minutes or till golden brown and puffy.
Meanwhile, beat together the remaining 8 eggs, milk, 1/4 teaspoon salt, and dash pepper. Stir in pea pods and green or red pepper.
In a large skillet melt the 1 tablespoon margarine. Pour in egg mixture. Cook, without stirring, till mixture begins to set on bottom and around edge, sprinkle with cheese.
Lift and fold egg mixture till eggs are cooked but still glossy and moist, and cheese melts. Spoon into baked puff shell.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

ingredients.item: sliced green onion or chopped green pepper

instructions.text: In a medium skillet cook mushrooms and green onion or green pepper in margarine or butter till tender.
In a bowl beat together eggs, milk, basil, dash salt, and dash pepper. Pour over mushroom mixture.

Cook, without stirring, till eggs begin to set on bottom and around edge. Lift and fold partially cooked eggs so uncooked portion flows underneath. Continue cooking till thoroughly cooked but still glossy and moist.
Sprinkle cheddar cheese over eggs. Remove from heat. Let stand 1 minute or till cheese melts slightly.
Halve pita bread round; spoon egg mixture into halves.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: French Omelet
recipes.description: The Vegetable French Omelet with zucchini and cheddar cheese is pictured.

instructions.text: In a bowl combine eggs, water, salt, and dash pepper. Using a fork, beat till combined but not frothy.
In an 8- or 10-inch skillet with flared sides, heat margarine or butter till a drop of water sizzles. Lift and tilt the pan to coat the sides.
Add egg mixture to skillet; cook over medium heat. As eggs set, run a spatula around the edge of the skillet, lifting eggs and letting uncooked portion flow underneath.
When eggs are set but still shiny, remove from the heat. Fold omelet in half. Transfer onto a warm plate.

notes: Microwave directions: In a bowl combine 3 eggs, 2 tablespoons water, salt, and dash pepper. In a 9-inch pie plate micro-cook 1 teaspoon margarine or butter on 100% power (high) for 30 to 40 seconds or till melted. Spread margarine to coat plate. Add egg mixture. Cook, uncovered, on high for 2-1/2 to 3-1/2 minutes or till eggs are set but still shiny, pushing cooked portions toward center every 30 seconds. Fold and serve as above. Serves 1 or 2.
Mushroom French Omelet: Prepare as above, except, for filling, cook 1/2 cup sliced fresh mushrooms in 1 tablespoon margarine till tender. Spoon across center of omelet. Fold sides over.

Cheese French Omelet: Prepare as above, except omit salt. For filling, sprinkle 1/4 cup shredded cheddar, Swiss, Monterey Jack, or American cheese across center of omelet. Fold sides over. Top with shredded cheese and snipped parsley.

Fruited French Omelet: Prepare as above, except, for filling, spread 2 tablespoons dairy sour cream or yogurt across center of omelet. Fold sides over. Top omelet with 1/4 cup halved strawberries; sliced, peeled peaches; or blueberries. Sprinkle with 1 tablespoon brown sugar.

Vegetable French Omelet: Prepare as above, except, for filling, cook 1/3 cup vegetables (combination of sliced asparagus, sliced zucchini, sliced green onion, sliced celery, or chopped green pepper) and 1/8 teaspoon dried basil, crushed, in 1 tablespoon margarine. Spoon filling across center of omelet. Sprinkle grated Parmesan, shredded cheddar, or crumbled feta cheese atop filling before folding omelet.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Denver Omelet
recipes.description: Chock-full of bright garden vegetables and ham.

instructions.text: Prepare Puffy Omelet (see separate recipe). Prepare filling while omelet is baking.
For filling, in a skillet melt margarine or butter. Add mushrooms, green pepper, green onions, and basil. Cook till tender but not brown.
Stir in ham strips and cherry tomatoes. Heat through.
Remove omelet from the oven. Fill omelet with ham mixture before folding.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Puffy Omelet

instructions.text: In a bowl beat egg whites till frothy. Add 2 tablespoons water; continue beating about 1-1/2 minutes or till stiff peaks form (tips stand straight). Fold egg yolks into egg whites.
In a large ovenproof skillet heat margarine till a drop of water sizzles. Pour in egg mixture, mounding it slightly higher at the sides.
Cook over low heat for 8 to 10 minutes or till puffed, set, and golden brown on the bottom.
Then bake in a 325° oven for 8 to 10 minutes or till a knife inserted near the center comes out clean.
Loosen sides of omelet with a metal spatula. Make a shallow cut slightly off center across the omelet. Fold smaller side over the larger side.

notes: Cheese-Herb Puffy Omelet: Prepare as above, except, while omelet is baking, melt 1 tablespoon margarine or butter in a saucepan. Stir in 1 tablespoon all-purpose flour, 1 teaspoon snipped chives, and 1/4 teaspoon dried fines herbes, crushed. Add 2/3 cup milk. Cook and stir till thickened and bubbly. Cook and stir 1 minute more. Stir in 1/2 cup shredded cheddar or Swiss cheese till melted. Pour over folded omelet.

Ham-and-Cheese Puffy Omelet: Prepare as above, except, while omelet is baking, melt 1 tablespoon margarine or butter in a saucepan. Stir in 1 tablespoon all-purpose flour. Add 2/3 cup milk. Cook and stir till thickened and bubbly. Cook and stir 1 minute more. Stir in 1/2 cup shredded cheddar or Swiss cheese till melted. Stir in 1/4 cup diced fully cooked ham and one 2-ounce jar sliced mushrooms, drained. Heat through. Pour over folded omelet.

Bacon-Asparagus Puffy Omelet: Prepare as above, except place one 10-ounce package frozen cut asparagus in a colander. Run hot water over asparagus till thawed; drain. Stir together 1/4 cup cold water, 1 tablespoon soy sauce, and 2 teaspoons cornstarch; set aside. In a skillet cook 2 slices bacon till crisp; drain, reserving drippings. Crumble bacon; set aside. Cook 1/4 cup chopped onion in drippings over medium heat till tender. Add asparagus; cook and stir for 3 minutes. Stir soy sauce mixture; add to skillet. Cook and stir till thickened and bubbly. Cook and stir 2 minutes more. Add bacon; spoon atop omelet before folding.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Frittata
recipes.description: An open-face omelet that's easy to whip up for a quick supper or breakfast.

instructions.text: In a bowl beat eggs and 1/4 teaspoon pepper; set aside.
In a 10-inch broilerproof or regular skillet cook onion and garlic in margarine or butter till tender. Stir in chopped vegetables or meat.

Pour egg mixture into skillet over vegetables or meat. Cook over medium heat. As mixture sets, run a spatula around edge of skillet, lifting egg mixture to allow uncooked portions to flow underneath. Continue cooking and lifting edges till egg mixture is almost set (surface will be moist).

Place broilerproof skillet under the broiler 4 to 5 inches from the heat. Broil for 1 to 2 minutes or till top is just set. (Or, if using a regular skillet, remove skillet from the heat; cover and let stand 3 to 4 minutes or till top is set.)
Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese. Cut into wedges.

notes: Microwave directions: In a 9-inch pie plate combine onion, garlic, and margarine. Micro-cook on 100% power (high) for 1 to 2 minutes or till onion is tender, stirring once. Stir in vegetables or meat. (If vegetables or meat are cold, cook mixture on high about 1 minute or till hot.) In a bowl beat together eggs and pepper. Pour into pie plate over hot vegetable or meat mixture. Cook on high for 3 to 5 minutes or till eggs are set but still shiny, lifting cooked edges every minute and letting portions flow underneath. Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese. Let stand for 5 minutes. Cut into wedges.

Greek Frittata: Prepare as above, except substitute 4 cups torn fresh spinach for the chopped cooked vegetables or meat. After adding spinach to onion and garlic in the skillet, cook for 2 to 3 minutes more or till spinach is limp. Substitute 1/2 cup crumbled feta cheese for Parmesan cheese. Do not use microwave directions.

Oven Frittata: Prepare as above, except use an ovenproof skillet. After pouring egg mixture into the skillet, bake in a 350° oven about 15 minutes or till a knife inserted near the center comes out clean.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Cheese Soufflé
recipes.description: Choose from four cheeses to make this melt-in-your-mouth dish.

ingredients.item: shredded cheddar, process Swiss, Colby, or Havarti cheese

instructions.text: Measure enough foil to wrap around a 2-quart soufflé dish with 6 inches to spare. Fold foil into thirds lengthwise. Lightly butter one side. With buttered side in, position foil around dish, letting it extend 2 inches above the top. Fasten the foil.
For cheese sauce, in a saucepan melt margarine or butter; stir in flour and red pepper. Add milk all at once. Cook and stir till thickened and bubbly.
Remove from the heat. Add cheese, 1 cup at a time, stirring till melted.
In a bowl beat yolks with a fork till combined. Slowly add cheese sauce to yolks, stirring constantly. Cool slightly.
In a bowl beat egg whites till stiff peaks form (tips stand straight). Gently fold about 2 cups of the stiffly beaten whites into cheese sauce.
Gradually pour cheese sauce over remaining stiffly beaten whites, folding to combine.
Pour into the ungreased soufflé dish. Bake in a 350° oven about 50 minutes or till a knife inserted near the center comes out clean.
Gently peel off foil; serve soufflé immediately.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Vegetable Soufflé
recipes.description: Puffs nicely in either a 10x6x2-inch dish or a soufflé dish.

ingredients.item: fresh marjoram, basil, dill, or tarragon
ingredients.prep_note: snipped; or 1/4 teaspoon dried herb, crushed

ingredients.item: finely chopped cooked broccoli, cauliflower, asparagus, carrot, or spinach

instructions.text: In a medium saucepan cook onion and garlic in margarine or butter till tender. Stir in flour, desired herb, salt, and pepper. Add milk all at once. Cook and stir till thickened and bubbly. Remove from heat. Add shredded cheese and stir till melted. Stir in vegetable.
In a bowl beat egg yolks with a fork till combined. Gradually add vegetable mixture, stirring constantly. Set aside.
In a bowl beat egg whites till stiff peaks form (tips stand straight). Gently fold about 1 cup of the beaten egg whites into vegetable mixture to lighten it.
Gradually pour vegetable mixture over remaining beaten egg whites, folding to combine. Pour into an ungreased 1-1/2-quart soufflé dish or a 10x6x2-inch baking dish.
Bake in a 350° oven about 40 minutes for the soufflé dish (25 to 30 minutes for the 10x6x2-inch baking dish) or till a knife inserted near the center comes out clean. Serve soufflé immediately.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Spinach Puff
recipes.description: Serve this soufflélike dish as an entrée, or as a side dish with fish or roast beef.
recipes.servings_yield: Makes 4 main-dish servings or 8 side-dish servings

instructions.text: Drain spinach well in a colander, pressing out liquid with a spoon. Grease a 1-quart soufflé dish or casserole; sprinkle with crumbs. Set aside.

In a bowl, blender container, or food processor bowl, combine cottage cheese and eggs. Add shredded cheese, flour, margarine, onion salt, and lemon peel. Beat with an electric mixer, or cover and blend or process till smooth. Stir in spinach.
Transfer mixture to the prepared dish. Bake in a 350° oven about 1 hour or till a knife inserted near the center comes out clean.

notes: Broccoli Puff: Prepare as above, except substitute frozen chopped broccoli for the spinach. Cook broccoli in boiling water for 4 to 5 minutes or till crisp-tender; drain well.
Blue Cheese and Bacon Puff: Prepare as above, except add 1/2 cup crumbled blue cheese with the shredded cheese. Stir in 4 slices crisp-cooked, crumbled bacon with the spinach.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Choose-a-Flavor Quiche
recipes.description: Mix and match the meat and cheese to suit your fancy, or rely on the classic bacon and Swiss cheese combination in Quiche Lorraine.

ingredients.item: chopped cooked chicken, crabmeat, or ham
shredded Swiss, cheddar, Monterey Jack, or Havarti cheese

instructions.text: Prepare Pastry for Single-Crust Pie. Line the unpricked pastry shell with a double thickness of heavy-duty foil. Bake in a 450° oven for 5 minutes. Remove foil. Bake for 5 to 7 minutes more or till pastry is nearly done. Remove from the oven. Reduce oven temperature to 325°.
Meanwhile, in a bowl stir together eggs, milk, onion, salt, pepper, and nutmeg. Stir in chicken, crabmeat, or ham. Toss together shredded cheese and flour. Add to egg mixture; mix well.

Pour egg mixture into hot pastry shell. Bake in the 325° oven for 35 to 40 minutes or till a knife inserted near the center comes out clean. If necessary, cover edge of crust with foil to prevent over-browning.
Let stand for 10 minutes before serving.

notes: Quiche Lorraine: Prepare as above, except omit green onion and chicken, crabmeat, or ham. Cook 6 slices bacon till crisp. Drain, reserving 2 tablespoons drippings. Crumble bacon; set aside. Cook 1 medium onion, sliced, in drippings over medium heat till tender; drain. Add bacon, onion, and Swiss-cheese-flour mixture to egg mixture.

Individual Quiche Casseroles: Prepare as above, except omit pastry and chicken, crabmeat, or ham. Pour egg mixture into four 10-ounce custard cups. Place custard cups in a 13x9x2-inch baking pan on an oven rack. Pour boiling water around cups in the pan to a depth of 1 inch. Bake in a 325° oven for 20 to 25 minutes or till a knife inserted near centers comes out clean. Serves 4.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Spinach-Egg Casserole

ingredients.item: English muffins, split and toasted, or toast points

instructions.text: For sauce, in a medium saucepan melt margarine. Stir in flour and 1/8 teaspoon pepper. Add milk. Cook and stir till thickened and bubbly. Add cheese. Cook and stir till cheese melts.
Measure 3/4 cup sauce; set aside. Stir spinach and ham into sauce in the saucepan.
Pour into a 1-1/2-quart casserole. Place egg halves atop mixture, pressing lightly. Pour reserved sauce over eggs.
Bake in a 350° oven about 30 minutes or till heated through. Serve over muffins or toast.

notes: To make ahead: Prepare as above, except do not bake. Cover casserole and refrigerate 2 to 24 hours. Bake, covered, in a 350° oven for 50 to 55 minutes or till heated through.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

ingredients.item: desired vegetables (olives, avocado, green onion, mushrooms, or tomato)
shredded cheddar, Swiss, or mozzarella cheese

instructions.text: For crust, unroll crescent rolls; separate into triangles. Place triangles on a lightly greased 12-inch pizza pan with points toward center. Press triangles together to cover bottom and 1/2 inch up sides of pan.
Bake in a 375° oven for 10 to 12 minutes or till lightly browned. (Do not remove crust from the oven.)
Meanwhile, combine beaten eggs, milk, oregano, and pepper.

When crust is lightly browned, leave on oven shelf (if necessary, press down any high spots in crust). Carefully pour egg mixture onto crust. Bake for 8 to 10 minutes more or till egg mixture is almost set.
Sprinkle with desired vegetables. Sprinkle with cheese; diced fully cooked ham; or chopped cooked turkey or chicken.
Return to the oven and bake 3 to 5 minutes more or till cheese melts. Cut into wedges.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Cheesy Brunch Roll-Ups

instructions.text: In a saucepan cook mushrooms, onion, and green pepper in margarine till tender. Drain.

Dividing mushroom mixture evenly, spoon along center of each tortilla. Divide the 1-1/2 cups cheese among the tortillas. Roll up tortillas and place, seam side down, in a greased 12x7-1/2x2-inch baking dish.
In a bowl stir together eggs, milk, flour, garlic powder, and pepper sauce. Pour over rolled-up tortillas.
Bake in a 350° oven for 35 to 40 minutes or till set. Sprinkle the 1/2 cup cheese over top. Let stand 10 minutes. Cut into 6 squares.

notes: To make ahead: Prepare as above, except do not bake. Cover and refrigerate 2 to 24 hours. Bake, uncovered, in a 350° oven for 45 to 50 minutes or till set.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Fettuccine with Cheese Sauce
recipes.description: Elegant for entertaining.

ingredients.item: packaged fettuccine, linguine, or egg noodles
shredded process Swiss, Gruyère, or American cheese

instructions.text: Cook fettuccine according to package directions. Drain; keep warm.

For cheese sauce, in a saucepan cook onion and garlic in margarine till tender. Stir in flour, bouillon granules, and the 1/8 teaspoon pepper. Add milk all at once. Cook and stir till thickened and bubbly. Cook and stir 1 minute more.
Stir in cheese. Cook and stir till cheese melts. Stir in parsley. If cheese sauce is too thick, stir in 1 to 2 tablespoons additional milk.
Serve cheese sauce over hot cooked pasta. Sprinkle with freshly ground pepper.

notes: Microwave directions: Cook fettuccine as above. For cheese sauce, in a 4-cup measure micro-cook onion, garlic, and margarine or butter on 100% power (high) for 1-1/2 to 2 minutes or till onion is tender. Stir in flour, bouillon granules, and the 1/8 teaspoon pepper. Add milk. Stir to combine. Cook on high for 3 to 5 minutes or till thickened and bubbly, stirring every minute till the sauce starts to thicken, then every 30 seconds. Cook for 30 seconds more. Add cheese; stir till melted. If necessary, cook on high for 15 to 30 seconds or till cheese melts. Serve as above.
Fettuccine with Broccoli and Cheese Sauce: Prepare as above, except add one 10-ounce package frozen chopped broccoli to pasta after it has simmered for 5 minutes.

Fettuccine with Asparagus and Swiss Cheese Sauce: Prepare as above, except add one 10-ounce package frozen cut asparagus to pasta after it has simmered for 5 minutes. For sauce, use the process Swiss cheese. Substitute 2 tablespoons toasted sliced almonds for the freshly ground pepper.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Cheese Strata

instructions.text: In a greased 8x8x2-inch baking dish layer 8 bread-slice halves, the cheese slices, then the remaining bread-slice halves.
Beat eggs; stir in milk, onion, mustard, 1/4 teaspoon salt, and 1/4 teaspoon pepper. Pour over bread and cheese layers. Sprinkle with paprika.
Cover; chill in the refrigerator for 2 to 24 hours.
Bake, uncovered, in a 325° oven for 45 to 50 minutes or till set and lightly browned. Let stand 10 minutes.

notes: Vegetable Cheese Strata: Prepare as above, except layer 1 cup chopped cooked broccoli or carrot atop cheese slices.
Meat Cheese Strata: Prepare as above, except layer 1 cup diced fully cooked ham or 1 cup diced cooked chicken or turkey atop cheese slices. (If using ham, omit salt.)

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Cheese-Stuffed Manicotti

instructions.text: Cook manicotti according to package directions; drain.

For sauce, in a saucepan cook onion and garlic in margarine till tender. Stir in flour. Add milk all at once. Cook and stir till thickened and bubbly. Add Swiss cheese and wine; stir till cheese melts.
In a bowl stir together egg, ricotta cheese, mozzarella cheese, Parmesan cheese, parsley, lemon peel, and nutmeg. Fill manicotti with ricotta mixture.
Arrange in a 12x7-1/2x2-inch baking dish. Pour sauce over filled shells.
Cover and bake in a 350° oven for 35 to 40 minutes or till hot.

notes: Microwave directions: Cook manicotti as above. For sauce, in a 4-cup measure combine onion, garlic, and margarine. Micro-cook on 100% power (high) for 1-1/2 to 2-1/2 minutes or till onion is tender. Stir in flour. Add 1 cup milk. Stir. Cook on high for 3 to 5 minutes or till thickened and bubbly, stirring every minute till sauce starts to thicken, then every 30 seconds. Add Swiss cheese and wine; stir till cheese melts. Fill manicotti as above. Pour sauce atop. Cook, covered with vented clear plastic wrap, on high for 4 to 6 minutes or till heated through, turning dish once.

Spinach Manicotti: Prepare as above, except reduce ricotta to 1/2 cup. Omit mozzarella and parsley. Add 1/2 cup crumbled feta cheese and one 10-ounce package frozen chopped spinach, thawed and drained, to ricotta mixture.

Creamy Lasagna: Prepare as above, except substitute 8 lasagna noodles for the manicotti. Spread 1/4 cup ricotta mixture over each cooked lasagna noodle. Roll up noodles and place, seam side down, in an 8x8x2-inch baking dish.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Venison Pot Roast
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 240
recipes.description: A hearty braised venison roast with vegetables, perfect for wild game.

instructions.text: In a Dutch oven brown meat on all sides in hot oil. Drain fat.
Add onion and carrot. Cover and simmer for 1-1/2 to 2 hours or till meat is tender.
Remove meat from pan. For sauce, stir flour into pan juices. Add broth. Cook and stir till thickened and bubbly.
Stir in yogurt. Heat through but do not boil. Slice meat and serve with sauce.

notes: Wild game tip: Venison can be gamey - marinating overnight helps mellow the flavor
Serve with mashed potatoes or egg noodles

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Marinated Venison Chops
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 240
recipes.description: Tender venison chops marinated in a savory oil and vinegar mixture.

ingredients.prep_note: single or 2 double, cut 3/4 inch thick (about 1-1/2 lb)

instructions.text: Place chops or steaks in a plastic bag set into a shallow dish. For marinade, combine oil, vinegar, Worcestershire sauce, garlic, salt, and pepper.
Pour over meat; close bag. Marinate in refrigerator for 6 to 24 hours, turning bag occasionally.
Remove venison from bag, reserving marinade. Place meat on unheated rack of a broiler pan.
Broil 3 inches from heat for 7 minutes, turning and brushing with marinade once.
Garnish with snipped parsley if desired.

notes: Marinating tip: The meat stays in the marinade bag making it easy to turn and rearrange. Cleanup is easy too - just toss the bag.
For medium-rare, broil until internal temperature reaches 145°F

assumptions: Assumed 1 unit for snipped parsley
Based on 8/8 ingredients (100% coverage)

recipes.title: Beer-Braised Rabbit
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 240
recipes.description: Tender braised rabbit with potatoes, carrots, and a savory beer sauce.

instructions.text: In a 12-inch skillet brown rabbit with salt and pepper in hot oil. Drain fat.
Add potatoes, carrots, and onion to skillet. Bring to boil.
Pour beer, chili sauce, and salt over rabbit and vegetables in skillet.
Cover and cook on high heat; reduce heat. Cover rabbit and vegetables and simmer for 35 to 45 minutes or till tender. Remove rabbit and vegetables.
For sauce, skim fat from pan juices. If necessary, add water to juices to equal 1-1/2 cups. Return to skillet.
Combine cold water and flour; stir into pan juices. Cook and stir till thickened and bubbly. Cook and stir for 1 minute more.
Serve sauce with rabbit and vegetables.

notes: Substitution: Apple juice can be used instead of beer for a family-friendly version
Rabbit is a lean, mild-tasting meat similar to chicken

assumptions: Based on 7/9 ingredients (78% coverage)

recipes.title: Veal Marsala
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 220
recipes.description: Classic Italian veal cutlets in a rich Marsala wine sauce with mushrooms.

ingredients.item: boneless veal leg top round steak or sirloin steak or pork tenderloin

instructions.text: Cut veal into 4 pieces. With a meat mallet, pound each piece to 1/8 inch thickness. If desired, sprinkle with salt and pepper.

In a large skillet cook half of the veal over medium-high heat in hot oil about 1 tablespoon of the oil for 2 minutes, turning once. Remove from skillet; keep warm. Repeat with remaining veal and oil.
Add mushrooms to skillet. Cook and stir for 1 minute. Add sherry and bouillon granules. Bring to boiling.
Return veal to skillet. Heat through. Serve immediately. If desired, sprinkle with snipped parsley.

notes: Variation: Pork tenderloin can be substituted for veal
For best results, pound the meat thin and cook quickly over high heat

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Beef Fajitas
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 220
recipes.description: Sizzling beef strips with peppers and onions, served in warm tortillas with toppings.

ingredients.item: boneless beef plate skirt steak or flank steak
medium green or sweet red or yellow pepper
shredded cheddar or Monterey Jack cheese

instructions.text: Partially freeze beef. Thinly slice across the grain into bite-size strips. Place strips in a plastic bag set into a deep bowl.
For marinade, in a mixing bowl stir together dressing, the 1/2 cup Salsa, lime juice, and Worcestershire sauce.
Pour over meat. Seal bag. Marinate in the refrigerator for 6 to 24 hours, stirring occasionally.

Wrap tortillas in foil. Seal bag. Meanwhile, in a 350° oven a large skillet on high heat, add oil. Cook and stir meat and onion for 1-1/2 minutes or till meat is no longer pink. Add pepper strips; cook about 1-1/2 minutes more.
Remove meat and vegetables from skillet. Add peppers and onion; cook and stir for 2 to 3 minutes or till crisp-tender.
Remove all beef and vegetables. Return all beef and vegetables to skillet. Add remaining beef and vegetables.
To serve, immediately fill tortillas with beef-vegetable mixture. If desired, add Guacamole, sour cream, cheese, and additional Salsa. Roll up.

notes: Tip: Partially freezing the beef makes it easier to slice thinly
For chicken fajitas, substitute 3/4 lb boneless skinless chicken breast
Serve with warm tortillas wrapped in foil in a 350° oven for 10 minutes

assumptions: Inferred 1.0 for dairy sour cream (standard quantity)
Inferred 1.0 for shredded cheddar or Monterey Jack cheese (standard quantity)
Assumed 1 unit for Salsa
Based on 11/12 ingredients (92% coverage)

recipes.title: Pastitsio
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 250
recipes.description: Classic Greek casserole with seasoned meat, pasta, and creamy béchamel sauce.

ingredients.item: ground lamb, ground beef, or ground pork

instructions.text: In a large skillet cook meat, onion, and garlic till meat is brown. Drain fat. Stir in tomato sauce, wine, parsley, oregano, cinnamon, and salt.
Bring to boiling; reduce heat. Simmer for 10 minutes or till most of liquid is absorbed. Gradually stir mixture into one of the beaten eggs; set aside.
For sauce, in a medium saucepan heat margarine till melted. Stir in flour. Add milk all at once. Cook and stir till thickened and bubbly. Cook and stir 1 minute more.
Gradually stir half of the hot mixture into remaining 2 beaten eggs. Return all of the egg mixture to saucepan. Stir in Parmesan cheese.
To assemble Pastitsio, in an 8x8x2-inch baking dish layer half of the macaroni, all of the meat mixture, remaining macaroni, and all of the sauce.
Bake in a 350° oven for 30 to 35 minutes or till set. Let stand 5 minutes before serving.

notes: Greek comfort food - similar to lasagna but with macaroni
Ground lamb is traditional but beef works well too
Can be assembled ahead and refrigerated; add 10-15 minutes to baking time if cold

assumptions: Based on 14/14 ingredients (100% coverage)

recipes.title: Macaroni and Cheese (BHG)
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 160
recipes.description: Classic baked macaroni and cheese with shredded American cheese.

instructions.text: Cook macaroni according to package directions (see chart, page 278); drain well.

Meanwhile, for cheese sauce, in a saucepan cook onion in margarine or butter till tender but not brown. Stir in flour and pepper. Add milk all at once. Cook and stir till slightly thickened and bubbly. Add shredded cheese; stir till melted.

Stir macaroni into cheese sauce. Transfer to a 1-quart casserole. Bake, uncovered, in a 350° oven for 25 to 30 minutes or till bubbly. During the last 5 minutes of baking, arrange tomato slices atop macaroni, if desired. Let stand 10 minutes.

notes: Microwave directions: Cook macaroni as above. For cheese sauce, in a 1-1/2-quart casserole micro-cook onion and margarine or butter on 100% power (high) for 1 to 2 minutes or till onion is tender. Stir in flour and pepper. Stir in milk. Cook on high for 3 to 5 minutes or till slightly thickened and bubbly, stirring every minute. Stir till cheese melts. Stir in cooked macaroni. Cook on high for 2-1/2 to 3-1/2 minutes or till heated through, stirring once. If desired, place tomato slices atop macaroni during the last minute of cooking. Let stand 10 minutes.

Vegetable Macaroni and Cheese: Prepare as above, except stir 2 cups frozen mixed vegetables, thawed, or one 16-ounce can mixed vegetables, drained, into cheese sauce with macaroni. Transfer to a 2-1/2-quart casserole.

Shortcut Macaroni and Cheese: Prepare as above, except immediately return the drained macaroni to the saucepan it was cooked in. Pour the cheese sauce over the macaroni; mix well. Cook over low heat for 3 to 5 minutes or till heated through, stirring frequently. Let stand for 10 minutes.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Welsh Rarebit Breakfast
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 160
recipes.description: Tangy cheese sauce served over English muffins with bacon or eggs - good for brunch, cauliflower, and burgers.

ingredients.prep_note: split and toasted, or 4 slices bread, toasted
warmed, or 4 poached eggs (see recipe, page 144)

instructions.text: For English muffin or toast stacks, place muffin halves or toast slices on plates. Top each with a slice of Canadian-style bacon, then a tomato slice; or, if using poached eggs, top muffins or toast with tomato slices, then eggs. Set aside.
For cheese sauce, in a heavy medium saucepan combine cheese, milk, mustard, Worcestershire sauce, and red pepper. Cook over low heat, stirring constantly, till cheese melts.
Slowly stir about half of the hot cheese sauce into beaten egg; return all to the saucepan. Cook and stir over low heat till cheese sauce thickens slightly and just bubbles.
Spoon cheese sauce immediately over English muffin or toast stacks.

notes: Microwave directions: Assemble English muffin or toast stacks as above. For sauce, in a 1-quart casserole combine cheese, milk, mustard, Worcestershire sauce, and red pepper. Micro-cook, covered, on 100% power (high) for 3 to 4 minutes or till cheese melts, stirring every minute. Slowly stir about half of the hot cheese mixture into beaten egg; return all to casserole. Cook on 50% power (medium) for 1 to 3 minutes or till mixture thickens slightly and just bubbles, stirring every 30 seconds. Serve as above.
Bacon Rarebit: Prepare as above, except substitute 8 slices crisp-cooked bacon, drained and halved crosswise, for the Canadian-style bacon or poached eggs. Substitute beer for the milk.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Meatless Red Beans and Rice
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 161 (Legumes section)
recipes.description: Adjust the amount of ground red pepper to give this dish the zing you like.

ingredients.item: dry red beans or dry red kidney beans

instructions.text: Rinse beans. In a large saucepan combine beans and 3 cups water. Bring to boiling; reduce heat. Simmer for 2 minutes. Remove from heat. Cover and let stand 1 hour. (Or, soak by placing beans and 3 cups water in a bowl. Cover and set in a cool place for 6 to 8 hours or overnight.)
Drain beans in a colander and rinse. Return beans to the saucepan. Stir in onion, garlic, bay leaf, salt, fennel seed, red pepper, and 3 cups fresh water.
Bring to boiling; reduce heat. Cover and simmer about 2-1/2 hours or till beans are tender, adding more water, if necessary, and stirring occasionally.
Uncover and simmer, stirring occasionally, for 15 to 20 minutes more or till a thick gravy forms. Discard bay leaf. Serve over rice.

notes: Meaty Red Beans and Rice: Prepare as above, except omit salt and fennel seed. Add 1/2 pound smoked pork hocks or meaty ham bone with onion. When beans are tender, remove hocks or ham bone. Cut meat from bones or bone. Discard bones or bone and return meat to bean mixture along with 1/2 pound smoked sausage, cut into bite-size pieces.
Red Beans and Corn Bread: Prepare as above, except omit rice and spoon bean mixture over squares of corn bread.

assumptions: Based on 7/8 ingredients (88% coverage)

recipes.title: Meatless Tacos
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 162
recipes.description: Hearty lentil-based tacos with tofu, a vegetarian alternative to traditional tacos.

instructions.text: Rinse lentils; drain. In a medium saucepan combine lentils, onion, and 1/2 cup water. Bring to boiling; reduce heat. Cover and simmer about 30 minutes or till tender and liquid is absorbed.
Stir tomato sauce and seasoning mix into lentils. Simmer, uncovered, for 5 minutes. Stir in tofu; heat through.
Spoon into taco shells. Top with lettuce, tomato, cheese, and salsa.

notes: Bulgur Tacos: Prepare as above, except substitute bulgur for lentils. Cover and simmer bulgur, onion, and 3/4 cup water about 10 minutes or till tender and liquid is absorbed.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Fried-Rice Supper
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 162
recipes.description: The rice is chilled to keep it from sticking. A quick and easy one-pan meal.

instructions.text: In a large skillet melt the 1 teaspoon margarine. Add beaten egg. Cook egg without stirring till set. Invert skillet to remove egg; cut into strips.
In the skillet cook onions and garlic in the 1 tablespoon margarine till tender. Add rice; cook and stir for 3 minutes.
Stir in beans, soy sauce, sherry, oil, and red pepper. Cook and stir till heated through.
Toss with nuts and egg strips.

notes: Tip: Chilling the rice keeps it from sticking and clumping when stir-fried
Quick meal - marked as FAST in cookbook

assumptions: Based on 12/12 ingredients (100% coverage)

recipes.title: Bean and Cheese Burritos
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 162
recipes.description: Easy baked burritos filled with refried beans and cheddar cheese.

instructions.text: Stack six 8-inch flour tortillas and wrap in foil. Heat in a 350° oven for 10 minutes to soften.
In a skillet cook 1 cup chopped onion in 1 tablespoon cooking oil till tender. Add one 16-ounce can refried beans. Cook and stir till heated through.
Spoon about 1/4 cup bean mixture onto each tortilla just below center. Divide 1-1/2 cups shredded cheddar cheese among tortillas.
Fold edge nearest filling up and over just till mixture is covered. Fold in 2 sides just till they meet; roll up.
Place on a baking sheet. Bake in a 350° oven about 10 minutes or till heated through. Serve with shredded lettuce and salsa.

notes: Bean and Cheese Chimichangas: Prepare as above, except use 10-inch flour tortillas and omit baking. Secure rolled-up tortillas with wooden toothpicks. In a 3-quart saucepan fry tortillas, 2 or 3 at a time, in 1 inch hot cooking oil (375°) about 1 minute on each side or till golden. Drain. Keep warm in a 300° oven. Remove picks. Pass dairy sour cream and guacamole.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Marinated Salmon Steaks
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 167
recipes.description: Salmon or halibut steaks marinated in a tangy lemon and herb mixture, then grilled or broiled.

ingredients.item: fresh or frozen salmon or halibut steaks

instructions.text: Thaw fish, if frozen. Cut steaks into serving-size portions.
For marinade, in a shallow dish combine onion, lemon or lime juice, oil, Worcestershire sauce, lemon-pepper, rosemary or thyme, and garlic.
Add fish to marinade, turning to coat. Cover and marinate in refrigerator for 2 hours, turning occasionally.
Drain fish, reserving marinade. Place fish on greased unheated rack of broiler pan. Broil 4 inches from heat for 5 minutes. Brush with marinade.
Turn fish over. Brush with marinade. Broil 3 to 7 minutes more or till fish flakes easily with a fork.

notes: Marked as EASY in cookbook

Grill directions: Marinate the fish as above. Drain fish, reserving marinade. Place fish steaks on a greased grill rack. Grill, uncovered, directly over medium-hot coals for 5 minutes. Using a wide spatula, carefully turn fish over. Brush with marinade. Grill for 3 to 7 minutes more or till fish flakes easily with a fork.

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 167)

recipes.title: Halibut with Sherry Sauce
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 168
recipes.description: Broiled halibut steaks with a creamy sherry and onion sauce.

ingredients.item: fresh or frozen halibut or other fish steaks

instructions.text: Thaw fish, if frozen. Place on the greased unheated rack of a broiler pan. Brush with half of the melted margarine. Sprinkle with pepper.
Broil 4 inches from heat 5 minutes, turn fish. Brush with remaining margarine, broil 3 to 7 more minutes or till fish flakes easily with a fork.
Meanwhile, cook onions and garlic in butter until tender. Add sherry, parsley, lemon-pepper. Cook and stir till reduced by about half.
Add cream. Cook and stir till mixture thickens slightly. Spoon sauce over fish.

notes: Marked as FAST in cookbook

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 168)

recipes.title: Teriyaki Shark
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 168
recipes.description: Shark or tuna steaks marinated in a sweet teriyaki glaze, then broiled.

ingredients.item: fresh or frozen shark or tuna steaks

instructions.text: Thaw fish, if frozen. For marinade, combine soy sauce, brown sugar, oil, sherry, gingerroot, and garlic.
Place fish in shallow dish. Pour marinade over fish. Cover and marinate for 30 minutes to 2 hours, turning occasionally.
Drain fish, reserving marinade. Place fish on greased unheated rack of broiler pan.
Broil 4 inches from heat for 5 minutes. Brush with marinade. Turn fish.
Broil 3 to 7 minutes more or till fish flakes easily with a fork, brushing with remaining marinade.

notes: Shark's firm texture holds up well to marinating and grilling

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 168)

recipes.title: Dijon-Mustard Fish Fillets
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 168
recipes.description: Broiled fish fillets topped with a creamy Dijon mustard sauce.

instructions.text: Thaw fish, if frozen. Measure thickness of fish.
Place fish on unheated rack of broiler pan. Broil 4 inches from heat till fish flakes easily with a fork. Allow 4 to 6 minutes per 1/2-inch thickness. Turn once if more than 1 inch thick.
Meanwhile, in small saucepan stir together sour cream, milk, mustard, and chives.
Cook and stir over low heat till heated through (do not boil). Spoon sauce over fish.

notes: Marked as FAST in cookbook
Do not boil the sauce or it may curdle

assumptions: Based on 5/5 ingredients (100% coverage)

recipes.title: Swordfish Kabobs
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 168
recipes.description: Marinated swordfish, tuna, or shark cubes on skewers with mushrooms and green onions.

ingredients.item: fresh or frozen swordfish, tuna, or shark

instructions.text: Thaw fish, if frozen. Cut into 1 inch cubes. Place fish, mushrooms, and onions in a plastic bag set in a bowl.
Combine oil, wine, garlic, orange peel, 1/4 teaspoon salt, and pepper. Add to bag. Seal bag and marinate at room temperature for 30 minutes (or in refrigerator for 2 hours), turning occasionally.
Drain fish cubes, reserving marinade. On eight 12-inch skewers, alternately thread fish cubes, mushrooms, and onion pieces.
Place on greased unheated rack of broiler pan. Broil 4 inches from heat for 4 to 5 minutes. Turn kabobs. Brush with marinade.
Broil 4 to 5 minutes more or till fish flakes easily with a fork.

notes: Swordfish's firm flesh makes it ideal for kabobs
Grill directions: Assemble and marinate kabobs as above. Add a cherry tomato to each skewer. Grill, uncovered, directly over medium-hot coals for 8 to 12 minutes, turning once.

assumptions: Based on 9/9 ingredients (100% coverage)

recipes.title: Sweet-and-Sour Fish Kabobs
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 169
recipes.description: Colorful fish kabobs with pineapple chunks and green pepper in a tangy sweet-and-sour sauce.

ingredients.item: fresh or frozen swordfish, sea bass, shark, or tuna steaks

instructions.text: Thaw fish, if frozen. Cut fish into 1-inch cubes.
For sauce, in a small saucepan combine pineapple preserves, reserved pineapple juice, rice vinegar, soy sauce, and cornstarch. Cook and stir till thickened and bubbly. Cook 2 minutes more.
On four 12-inch skewers, alternately thread fish cubes, pineapple chunks, and green pepper pieces, leaving about 1/4 inch between pieces.

Place kabobs on greased unheated rack of broiler pan. Broil 4 inches from heat for 5 minutes. Turn kabobs over. Broil 4 to 5 minutes more or till fish flakes easily with a fork, brushing with sauce during last 2 minutes.
Brush again with sauce before serving.

notes: Grill directions: Prepare sauce and assemble kabobs as above. Place kabobs on a greased grill rack. Grill, uncovered, directly over medium-hot coals for 4 to 6 minutes. Turn kabobs. Grill for 4 to 6 minutes more or till fish flakes easily with a fork, brushing with sauce during last 2 minutes of grilling.

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 169)

recipes.title: Blackened Thai Catfish
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 169
recipes.description: Cajun-spiced catfish fillets cooked in a very hot cast-iron skillet until blackened.

instructions.text: Thaw fish, if frozen. Measure thickness of fish.
Combine garlic powder, white pepper, red pepper, thyme, and 1/4 teaspoon salt. Sprinkle spice mixture evenly on both sides of fish fillets.
In a 12-inch cast-iron or heavy skillet, melt 1 tablespoon margarine over medium-high heat.
Add fish fillets. Cook 3 to 4 minutes per side for 1/2-inch thick fillets (or 4 to 5 minutes per side for thicker fillets) or till fish flakes easily with a fork.
Add remaining margarine during cooking. Drizzle melted margarine over fish before serving.

notes: Stand back! This Cajun specialty really smokes up as it cooks. That's why it's best to grill.
To cook outdoors: Turn on exhaust fan or cook outside. Place a cast-iron skillet on the grill rack directly over hot coals. Heat until drops of water sizzle.

assumptions: Based on 6/6 ingredients (100% coverage)

recipes.title: Dill Smoked Cod
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 169
recipes.description: Whole dressed cod slow-smoked on the grill with dill and wood chips.

ingredients.item: fresh or frozen dressed cod or other fish

instructions.text: Thaw fish, if frozen. Soak wood chips in enough water to cover for 1 hour.
Meanwhile, cut 1/2-inch-deep diagonal slits 1 inch apart into both sides of fish.
Rub oil into slits. Then press a piece of dillweed into each slit. Use wooden toothpicks to hold fish together if needed.
Drain chips. In a covered grill, arrange preheated coals around a foil drip pan. Test for medium coals.
Place chips on coals. Place foil on rack above drip pan. Place the fish on foil.
Grill fish, covered, 50 to 60 minutes or till fish flakes easily with a fork.

notes: Cherry or apple wood chips add a mild, sweet smoke flavor
The diagonal slits help the dill flavor penetrate the fish

assumptions: Based on 4/4 ingredients (100% coverage)

recipes.title: Fish with Beer-Cheese Sauce
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 170
recipes.description: Baked fish fillets topped with a creamy beer and American cheese sauce.

ingredients.item: fresh or frozen fish fillets or steaks

instructions.text: Thaw fish, if frozen. Measure thickness of fish.
Place fish in a greased baking dish. Bake in a 450°F oven till fish flakes easily with a fork (allow 4 to 6 minutes per 1/2-inch thickness, tucking under thin edges).
Meanwhile, for sauce, cook green onion in margarine till tender. Stir in flour.
Add milk all at once. Cook and stir till thickened and bubbly. Cook 1 minute more.
Add cheese and beer. Cook and stir till cheese melts. Spoon sauce over fish.

notes: Marked as FAST in cookbook

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 170)

recipes.title: Citrus Baked Halibut
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 170
recipes.description: Baked halibut steaks topped with a citrus and herb mixture.

instructions.text: Thaw fish, if frozen. Arrange in an 8x8-inch baking dish.
Cook onion and garlic in margarine till tender. Stir in parsley, lemon peel, and orange juice.
Spread mixture over fish. Sprinkle with dillweed.
Bake in a 400°F oven for 15 to 20 minutes or till fish flakes easily with a fork.

notes: Microwave directions: Arrange fish in an 8x8x2-inch microwave-safe baking dish. Cook onion, garlic, and margarine on 100% power (high) for 1 to 2 minutes. Stir in parsley, lemon peel, and orange juice. Spread over fish. Sprinkle with dillweed. Cover with vented plastic wrap. Cook on high for 7 to 9 minutes, giving dish a half-turn once.

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 170)

recipes.title: Fish Potpies
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 170
recipes.description: Individual fish potpies with vegetables and Swiss cheese in marinara sauce, topped with pastry.

ingredients.item: fresh or frozen haddock, cod, or orange roughy fillets

instructions.text: Thaw fish, if frozen. In saucepan combine marinara sauce, vegetables, carrot, cheese, parsley, and pimiento. Cook and stir till thickened and bubbly.
Cut fish into four pieces; stir into cheese mixture.
Spoon into four greased 8 or 10-ounce casseroles.
Cut pastry into 4 wedges. Place one pastry wedge on each casserole. Trim to fit. Cut slits into pastry.
Place on a baking sheet. Bake in a 400°F oven for 20 to 25 minutes or till golden brown. Let stand 10 minutes before serving.

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 170)

recipes.title: Fish Stacks
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 170
recipes.description: Fish fillets topped with creamy vegetable mixture and crescent roll dough.

instructions.text: Thaw fish fillets. Cut into 4x3-inch portions. Place in a shallow baking dish.
Cook onion, carrot, and mushrooms in margarine, covered, about 5 minutes. Uncover; simmer 2 to 4 minutes more or till excess liquid evaporates.
Remove from heat. Stir in cream cheese, dillweed, and pepper. Spoon vegetable mixture over each fish portion.
Separate crescent rolls into 2 rectangles. Pinch perforations to seal. Cut each rectangle in half.
Place one rectangle atop each fish portion. Brush dough with milk, if desired.
Bake in a 350°F oven for 20 to 25 minutes or till fish is done and dough is golden.

notes: The cream cheese and vegetable topping keeps the fish moist

assumptions: Based on 9/9 ingredients (100% coverage)

recipes.title: Broccoli-Stuffed Sole
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 171
recipes.description: Delicate sole fillets rolled around a broccoli and Parmesan cheese filling.

ingredients.item: fresh or frozen skinless sole fillets
soft-style cream cheese with chives and onion

instructions.text: Thaw fish, if frozen.
For filling, combine broccoli, Parmesan cheese, cream cheese, and pine nuts.
Place about 1/4 cup filling on one end of each fillet. Roll up fillets.
Secure rolls with wooden picks. Place in a baking dish. Drizzle with wine.
Bake in a 350°F oven for 30 to 35 minutes or till fish flakes easily with a fork.

notes: Microwave directions: Assemble fish rolls, omitting wine. Place in a microwave-safe dish. Cover with vented plastic wrap. Microwave on 100% power (high) for 3 to 5 minutes or till fish flakes easily, giving dish a half-turn once.

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 171)

recipes.title: Baked Fish with Mushrooms
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 171
recipes.description: Quick baked fish fillets topped with sauteed mushrooms and green onions.

ingredients.item: fresh or frozen fish fillets or steaks

instructions.text: Thaw fish, if frozen. Arrange fish in a 12x7-1/2x2-inch baking dish, turning under thin edges. Sprinkle with salt.
Cook mushrooms, onion, and tarragon in margarine till tender. Spoon over fish.
Sprinkle with paprika. Bake, covered, in a 450°F oven for 6 to 10 minutes or till fish flakes easily with a fork.

notes: Marked as FAST in cookbook

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 171)

recipes.title: Wild-Rice-Stuffed Fish
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 171
recipes.description: Whole dressed fish stuffed with a wild rice, mushroom, and vegetable mixture.

ingredients.item: fresh or frozen dressed whitefish or other fish

instructions.text: Thaw fish, if frozen. Rinse rice thoroughly.
Cook mushrooms, celery, onion, and garlic in margarine till tender.
Stir in broth and wild rice. Cover and simmer 45 to 50 minutes till rice is tender and liquid is absorbed.
Stir in pimiento, sherry, parsley, and lemon peel.
Spoon stuffing into fish cavities, pressing lightly with back of spoon so fish lies flat.
Place stuffed fish in a large baking dish. Cover loosely with foil.
Bake in a 350°F oven for 30 to 40 minutes or till fish flakes easily with a fork. Use two large spatulas to transfer fish to serving platter.

notes: Tip: Spoon stuffing into fish, then press lightly with the back of the spoon so the fish lies flat
Use two large spatulas for transferring the stuffed fish

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 171)

recipes.title: Fish en Papillote
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 172
recipes.description: Elegant French technique of baking fish in parchment paper packets with a creamy vegetable sauce.

ingredients.item: fresh or frozen skinless flounder, perch, sole, or pompano fillets

ingredients.prep_note: cut into heart shapes, 12 inches wide and 9 inches long

instructions.text: Thaw fish, if frozen. Cut 4 pieces of parchment paper into heart shapes, 12 inches wide and 9 inches long.
In a large skillet bring water, lemon slices, bay leaf, and bouillon granules to boiling. Add fish.
Simmer, covered, for 4 to 6 minutes or till fish flakes easily with a fork. Using a slotted spoon, remove fish. Reserve 1/2 cup cooking liquid.
In same skillet cook carrots and onion in margarine till tender. Stir in flour and mustard.
Add reserved liquid and milk. Cook and stir till thickened and bubbly. Cook and stir 1 minute more.
To assemble, place one fillet on one half of each parchment heart. Top with one fourth of the sauce.
Fold the other half of the heart over fillet. Starting at the top, seal tightly by turning up edges and folding in twice. At bottom, twist the tip of heart to seal.
Place packets on a large baking sheet. Bake in a 400°F oven for 10 to 12 minutes or till slightly puffed.
Transfer to dinner plates. To serve, cut an X in top of each packet. Pull back the paper.

notes: En papillote (pah-pee-YOHT) is French for 'in paper' - a simple yet elegant way to cook fish
The packets puff up as steam forms inside, creating a dramatic presentation

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 172)

recipes.title: Chilled Salmon Steaks with Tarragon Sauce
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 173
recipes.description: Poached salmon steaks served chilled with a tangy tarragon dressing.

instructions.text: Thaw salmon, if frozen.
In large skillet bring water or Court Bouillon to boiling. Add salmon steaks. Return to boiling; reduce heat.
Simmer, covered, 8 to 12 minutes or till fish flakes easily with a fork.
Remove fish; cool. Remove skin. Cover and chill up to 24 hours.
For dressing, in a jar combine onion, broth, oil, tarragon, parsley, mustard, sugar, and pepper. Shake well.
Pour dressing over chilled salmon and serve.

notes: Perfect for warm weather entertaining
Can be chilled up to 24 hours ahead

assumptions: Based on 9/9 ingredients (100% coverage)

recipes.title: Poached Fish with Dill Sauce
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 173
recipes.description: Whole poached fish served with a creamy dill sauce.

instructions.text: Thaw fish, if frozen.
In a fish poacher or large roasting pan with a wire rack with handles, add enough water to almost reach the rack. Add bay leaf, tarragon, and lemon slices.
Place fish on rack. Lower into pan. Simmer, covered, 35 to 40 minutes or till fish flakes easily with a fork.
Remove fish; keep warm. Reserve 1/4 cup cooking liquid.
For sauce, in a saucepan melt margarine. Stir in flour and dillweed. Add reserved liquid and milk. Cook and stir till thickened and bubbly. Cook 1 minute more.
Serve sauce over fish.

recipes.pan_size: fish poacher or large roasting pan
notes: Use a fish poacher with rack for easy removal of whole fish

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 173)

recipes.title: Vegetable-Topped Fillets
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 173
recipes.description: Colorful fish fillets topped with sauteed summer squash, zucchini, and tomatoes.

ingredients.item: fresh or frozen skinless sole or other white fish fillets

instructions.text: Thaw fish, if frozen. Measure thickness of fish.
Place fish in a greased baking dish. Bake in a 450°F oven till fish flakes easily (4 to 6 minutes per 1/2-inch thickness).
Meanwhile, in a skillet cook zucchini, summer squash, and garlic in margarine till nearly tender.
Add tomatoes and basil. Cook and stir 2 minutes more.
Spoon vegetable mixture over baked fish.

notes: A colorful, healthy topping for mild white fish
Microwave directions: Cook vegetables in margarine in a microwave-safe dish on high for 4 to 5 minutes, stirring once. Add tomatoes and basil; cook 1 minute more.

assumptions: Based on 7/7 ingredients (100% coverage)

recipes.title: Trout Amandine
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 174
recipes.description: Classic French preparation of pan-fried trout topped with buttery toasted almonds.

ingredients.item: fresh or frozen pan-dressed trout or other fish

instructions.text: Thaw fish, if frozen. Bone fish, if desired.
Combine flour and 1/4 teaspoon salt. Stir together egg and milk.
Dip fish in flour mixture to coat, then in egg mixture.
In a 12-inch skillet heat oil. Fry fish in hot oil for 5 to 6 minutes on each side or till golden and fish flakes easily with a fork.
Remove fish and keep warm.
In a medium saucepan melt margarine. Cook sliced almonds till golden.
Place fish on a serving platter. Spoon almond mixture over fish. Garnish with lemon slices.

notes: Marked as FAST in cookbook
The perfect recipe for freshly caught fish - 'It's in your pan, but your catch of the day!'

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 174)

recipes.title: Pan-Fried Fish
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 174
recipes.description: Classic cornmeal-crusted pan-fried fish fillets with crispy coating.

ingredients.item: cornmeal or fine dry bread crumbs

instructions.text: Thaw fish, if frozen. Measure thickness of fish. Cut into serving-size portions. Pat dry.
In a shallow dish combine egg and 2 tablespoons water.
In another dish, mix cornmeal or bread crumbs, salt, and pepper.
Dip fish into egg mixture, then coat with cornmeal mixture.
Fry the fish in hot oil on one side till golden. Turn and cook on the other side (3 to 4 minutes per side for 1/4-inch-thick fillets, longer for thicker fish).

notes: The crispy coating seals in the fresh fish flavor
